alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 4:10AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL TAPER OFF TODAY. THE NEXT STORM WILL ARRIVE LATE MONDAY... .Winter weather advisories will end this morning with little to no additional accumulations. Cascade mountains will see light snow through mid morning. The next storm will arrive late Monday and continue through Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 3 feet possible, with higher amounts at the Cascade Crest. Winds could gust as high as 55 to 60 mph. * WHERE...Stehekin, Stevens Pass, and Holden Village. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates of 1 inch or more per hour will likely occur at Stevens Pass for a long duration on Tuesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
